CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1941 reads: "To Be Known As Robert L. Vann School - The Board of Education this week voted to name the school pictured above in honor of Robert L. Vann, internationally famous publisher and statesman. The present name, Watt Street school, will be changed to the Robert L. Vann school.  This is one of the two educational structures dedicated to the late publisher or The Pittsburgh Courier.  Some time in fall Virginia Union university, Richmond, Va., will dedicate the Robert L. Vann tower in his honor. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Watt Elementary school (Robert L. Vann) building, with inscription "Watt School 1914" above entryway, dark fence and car in foreground at 631 Watt Street, another version
